column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/03/john-spytek-talks-bucs-offensive-line/|John Spytek Talks Bucs’ Offensive Line|So 2024 Bucs assistant GM John Spytek now is in Las Vegas as an underboss to Tom Brady
column2: but he still likes to talk about his Tampa Bay experience. Joining PFT Live last week
column3: Spytek was asked about offensive line building. He wasn’t asked about the Bucs’ offensive line
column4: but that’s where he went. “We kind of established a mentality in those guys and a character that made them a cohesive group
column5: ” Spytek said of the Bucs’ line. “I mean
column6: that [Bucs offensive line] in Tampa last year was a group of really special people and players and
column8: we kind of had some non-negotiables of what we were looking for
column9: both character and really physical traits. And we kind of just stuck to those things and
column11: we grew a good group together. The continuity they had and their durability in particular
column12: like those guys played a lot of games together. That working mentality was awesome. Just the like-mindedness of it
column13: those guys hung out all the time.” Spytek also stressed that he believes the strength of the Bucs through the past six seasons has been the O-line. He also gave Buccaneers Ring of Honor general manager credit for believing in small-school tackles and their ability to move inside effectively in the NFL. The list is long
column14: and it includes retired center Ryan Jensen. In the case of Luke Goedeke
column15: he moved inside then back outside and has thrived. Frankly
column16: Joe thinks Goedeke could be a good guard
column18: all this Spytek chatter means little to Joe other than it’s more evidence that the team wants to re-sign pending free agent left guard Ben Bredeson. Ira Kaufman Talks Khalil Mack
